latest news.eng_title: Apple's latest addition to its $5 billion campus is built into a hillside like a modern-day Hobbit hole
latest news.summary: Apple's new campus building, Apple Park Observatory, resembles a futuristic Hobbit hole from J.R.R. Tolkien's books. The subterranean venue is built into the hillside of Apple Park, the company's $5 billion headquarters in Cupertino, California. According to Dezeen, the event space is designed to host Apple employees, tech journalists, and YouTubers to showcase the company's latest gadgets. As Dezeen describes it, 'it was a great day' to unveil the new venue, but it's unclear who said this. The Apple Park Observatory is a unique addition to the company's campus, blending seamlessly into the surrounding landscape.
latest news.title: Apple's latest addition to its $5 billion campus is built into a hillside like a modern-day Hobbit hole

latest news.eng_title: Tesla's Wireless Charging System: A Potential Game-Changer for Electric Vehicles
latest news.summary: Tesla is working on a wireless charging system, which could revolutionize the electric vehicle industry. According to multiple patents filed by Tesla, this innovation could make recharging easier and more practical for users. On social media, users have been discussing the potential of this technology, with some expressing skepticism about the feasibility of wireless charging. However, others have pointed out that the efficiency of wireless charging is not as low as previously thought, with some studies showing a high efficiency rate. Tesla's acquisition of a German wireless charging tech company, Wiferion, for $76 million, has also been cited as evidence of their commitment to this technology. While some users are skeptical about Tesla's resources and ability to commercialize this technology, others are excited about the potential of this innovation. Ultimately, the success of this project will depend on Tesla's ability to overcome technical and economic challenges.
latest news.title: Le Système de Recharge Sans Fil de Tesla, Une Réalité de Plus en Plus Proche

latest news.eng_title: Tesla patents wireless charging for the Robotaxi
latest news.summary: Tesla is expected to unveil its Robotaxi, a fully self-driving vehicle, on October 10 in Los Angeles. According to recent patents, the company may also announce wireless charging technology for the vehicle. Wireless charging is not new to Tesla, but the company has been working on a new system, titled 'Estimating Parameters for Wireless Charging', which involves a plate placed on the floor that the car parks on to receive energy. Elon Musk previously showed a picture of a snake-like charger, and mobile robotic charging stations have been hypothesised by other manufacturers. However, wireless charging would solve many problems, and it is likely that Tesla will make this option available on other cars in production, although it may not be compatible with cars already on the road.
latest news.title: Tesla patents wireless charging for the Robotaxi

latest news.eng_title: Tesla Cars Spotted in Florida Field, Raising Questions About Abandonment
latest news.summary: Hundreds of brand new Tesla electric cars have been spotted in a field in Tampa, Florida, sparking questions about whether they were abandoned. According to a Reddit user who shared photos of the scene, the cars, including Tesla Model 3s from 2022 and 2023, were parked in a pasture. 'Does anyone know what this is?' the user asked. While some speculated that the high grass and humidity could cause oxidation or attract rodents, another user contacted the local service center and discovered that the field is being used as a overflow lot for new inventory. The company reportedly ran out of space in its main Florida facilities, necessitating an additional location. However, this explanation has raised doubts, as overflow vehicles are typically stored in private parking lots. Experts warn that cars left in a field with high grass and exposed to the elements for months can pose problems for future buyers.
latest news.title: Aparecen cientos de autos Tesla en un campo de Florida y ciudadanos se cuestionan si fueron abandonados Entrelineas

latest news.eng_title: Getaway Space Partners with Urth Caffé to Bring Iconic Menu to Los Angeles' Premier Electric Vehicle Charging Café
latest news.summary: Getaway Space, a premium Electric Vehicle (EV) charging café in Los Angeles, has partnered with Urth Caffé to bring their iconic menu to the venue. This collaboration will offer customers a unique experience where they can recharge their vehicles and themselves with sustainable technology and gourmet dining. According to Steve Kuh, CEO of Getaway Space, 'We are thrilled to partner with Urth Caffé, a brand synonymous with quality, sustainability, and innovation.' Shallom Berkman, President of Urth Caffé, added, 'This partnership with Getaway Space is an exciting new chapter for Urth Caffé. We have always believed in creating an experience that is as good for the planet as it is for the body.' The licensed menu will feature Urth Caffé's popular items, including beverages, organic salads, artisan sandwiches, and freshly baked pastries.
latest news.title: Getaway Space Partners with Urth Caffé to Bring Iconic Menu to Los Angeles' Premier Electric Vehicle Charging Café

latest news.eng_title: Goldman Sachs Maintains Neutral Rating on Rivian with $13 Target Price
latest news.summary: Goldman Sachs has maintained its neutral rating on Rivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:RIVN) with a target price of $13. The bank's analysis highlighted several key points regarding the electric vehicle producer's prospects and challenges. Rivian's 2024 goals include modest growth in volumes, but the company must face obstacles such as persistent supply chain problems noted in the third quarter and broader macroeconomic factors. Despite these concerns, Goldman Sachs identified potential long-term growth factors for Rivian, including the introduction of the R2 platform and the expansion of commercial vehicle sales to customers other than Amazon. The bank also mentioned the potential joint venture with Volkswagen as a favorable move for Rivian, which is expected to provide liquidity during the increase in production at the Rivian plant in Georgia and bring benefits in terms of costs through improved operational efficiency. Rivian aims to achieve a modest net profit in the fourth quarter of 2024 and targets profitability for the entire year 2025. In recent news, Rivian Automotive and Volkswagen have made significant progress in their respective sectors. Rivian has increased production for its second-generation R1 vehicles and is developing the R2 platform, which is expected to be launched in 2026. The company has also initiated a joint venture with Volkswagen Group, which is expected to bring cost savings, operational efficiency, and future income streams. However, Rivian has faced some setbacks, including a fire at its Illinois plant that damaged several electric vehicles and a pause in production of its electric vans due to a shortage of components. Despite these challenges, Rivian remains optimistic about recovering lost production time and plans to open another assembly plant in Georgia. While Rivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:RIVN) faces growth and operational challenges, a look at the real-time data on InvestingPro provides a more in-depth financial perspective. Rivian has a market capitalization of $13.34 billion, reflecting its position in the electric vehicle market. Despite the company's ambitious growth targets, analysts have expressed concerns, noting that Rivian is rapidly burning liquidity and must still become profitable, with eight analysts revising downward their earnings estimates for the next period. InvestingPro's suggestions indicate that, while Rivian has more liquidity than debt on its balance sheet, which is a positive sign, its weak gross profit margins and expectation that it will not be profitable this year must be considered by investors. From a valuation perspective, Rivian's Price/Earnings (P/E) ratio stands at -2.38, indicating that the company is not currently generating net earnings. The company's revenue growth has been significant, at 68.2% over the last 12 months to the second quarter 2024, but is accompanied by a substantial gross profit margin of -41.1%, highlighting the challenges on costs faced. Additionally, the price movements of Rivian's shares have been quite volatile, which may interest some investors, but it is worth noting that the valuation implies a low return on free cash flow, according to InvestingPro's suggestions. For those interested in further details, there are additional suggestions listed on InvestingPro, accessible for Rivian at https://www.investing.com/pro/RIVN.
latest news.title: Goldman Sachs mantiene il rating neutrale su Rivian, con target price a $13 Da Investing.com

latest news.eng_title: Goldman Sachs Maintains Neutral View on Rivian, $13 Price Target
latest news.summary: Goldman Sachs has maintained its neutral view and $13 price target for Rivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:RIVN). The firm's analysis highlighted several key points about the electric vehicle manufacturer's outlook and challenges. Rivian's 2024 targets include modest single-digit volume growth, but the company faces ongoing supply chain issues and broader macroeconomic factors. Looking beyond immediate concerns, Goldman Sachs identified potential long-term growth drivers for Rivian, including the introduction of the R2 platform and the expansion of commercial vehicle sales to non-Amazon customers. Additionally, the potential partnership with Volkswagen is seen as a positive move for Rivian, with the strategic alliance expected to provide liquidity and cost savings through improved operational efficiency. Finally, Goldman Sachs touched on Rivian's profitability targets, with the company aiming for modest gross profit in the fourth quarter of 2024 and profitability for the full year 2025. Other recent news, Rivian Automotive and Volkswagen are taking significant steps in their respective industries. Rivian is reporting progress on its production, strategic partnerships, and path to profitability in its second-quarter earnings report. The company is increasing production of its second-generation R1 vehicles and developing the R2 platform, which is expected to be launched in 2026. Rivian has also entered into a joint venture with Volkswagen Group, which is expected to provide cost savings, operational efficiency, and future revenue streams. On the other hand, Volkswagen's CEO, Oliver Blume, is facing challenges from the IG Metall union in Germany, including potential factory closures. Blume is under pressure to make tough decisions, including a potential $5 billion investment in Rivian and a partnership with Chinese Xpeng. Rivian has also faced some setbacks, including a fire at its Illinois facility that damaged several electric vehicles and a shortage of parts, which has halted production of its electric delivery vans. Despite these challenges, Rivian is optimistic about making up for lost production time and has plans to build another manufacturing facility in Georgia.
latest news.title: Goldman Sachs, Rivian için nötr görüşünü koruyor, hedef fiyatı 13 dolar Yazar Investing.com

news knowledge.eng_title: Scout's Long-Awaited Return Just Got A Reveal Date And It's Sooner Than We Expected
news knowledge.summary: Volkswagen's revived Scout brand is set to make its official reveal on October 24, 2024, 44 years after the last Scout II rolled off the production line. According to the Scout Motors homepage, the event will take place on October 24, as stated in the message 'Scout revealing 10.24.2024.' The upcoming models, which will be electric, will be built in the United States at the Scout Motors Production Center in Blythewood, South Carolina. Although the exact details of the vehicles are still unknown, buyers will have a choice between an SUV or a pickup truck version. The company has partnered with Rivian to develop the technology for the new model, and construction on the 1,100-acre facility started in February 2024.
news knowledge.title: Scout's Long-Awaited Return Just Got A Reveal Date And It's Sooner Than We Expected

news knowledge.eng_title: Fire At Rivian Campus, Tesla Analyst Hints At Q3 'Horror Show,' XPeng's Model 3 Killer Sizzles And More: Biggest EV Stories Of The Week
news knowledge.summary: Tesla extended its 'zero-interest' financing scheme in China until the end of September, sparking concerns about margin erosion. GLJ Research's Gordon Johnson called it a 'horror show' for Tesla's third-quarter margins. Meanwhile, Tesla is set to launch a seven-seat version of its Model Y in Europe and China in October. Rivian's Illinois plant was affected by a fire that damaged several EVs, but the company confirmed that the plant was unaffected and there were no injuries. Lucid is working on a Tesla Model 3 rival, with three affordable models in the pipeline. XPeng's new low-end electric-vehicle model, Mona M03, has received 30,000 firm orders in the first 48 hours of availability and is competitively priced. BYD is looking to generate nearly half of its sales from the overseas market in the future. The KraneShares Electric Vehicles and Future Mobility Index ETF ended the week up 0.79%.
news knowledge.title: Fire At Rivian Campus, Tesla Analyst Hints At Q3 'Horror Show,' XPeng's Model 3 Killer Sizzles And More: Biggest EV Stories Of The Week

news knowledge.eng_title: Rivian to participate in the Goldman Sachs Communacopia + Technology Conference
news knowledge.summary: Rivian Automotive, Inc. announced that its CFO, Claire McDonough, will participate in a fireside chat at the 2024 Goldman Sachs Communacopia + Technology Conference on September 9th, 2024, at 08:50am PT. A live webcast of the event will be available on the company's website. Rivian is an American automotive manufacturer that develops and builds electric vehicles and accessories, with a mission to accelerate the global transition to zero-emission transportation and energy. The company provides a full suite of services for its vehicles and aims to preserve the natural world for future generations.
news knowledge.title: Rivian to participate in the Goldman Sachs Communacopia + Technology Conference

news knowledge.eng_title: Rivian posts 'defining' Q2 earnings even as future remains uncertain
news knowledge.summary: Rivian published its second quarter earnings, with mixed results. The company produced 9,612 vehicles and delivered 13,790 vehicles, a drop from previous quarters but in line with expectations due to retooling at its manufacturing facility. Rivian unveiled two new in-house motor configurations and launched a second generation of the R1 platform, which includes hundreds of design, engineering, and performance upgrades. Revenue rose to $US1.16 billion, beating market expectations, but gross profit losses increased year-over-year to $US451 million. Net loss for the second quarter of 2024 increased to $US1,547 million. CEO RJ Scaringe said the company will likely see cost reduction from the factory retooling realised in the second half of the year, reaffirming the company's target of reaching a profit in the last quarter of 2024. Scaringe also stated, 'The second quarter has been a defining one for Rivian.' He added, 'We have demonstrated strong execution during the quarter with the plant retooling upgrade and launch of second generation R1 vehicles.' Rivian is also partnering with Volkswagen Group to develop next-generation electrical/electronic architecture for electric vehicles, with Volkswagen committing to invest up to $US5 billion.
news knowledge.title: Rivian posts 'defining' Q2 earnings even as future remains uncertain

news knowledge.eng_title: Hold On! Don't Buy Rivian Stock Ahead of Earnings. Wait for the Drop.
news knowledge.summary: Rivian Automotive (NASDAQ:RIVN) is expected to release its second-quarter 2024 earnings after the bell on August 6. Based on its key financial and operational indicators, Rivian stock is a 'Hold' going into the upcoming earnings report. While production and delivery figures have met expectations, profitability still needs to be achieved. The company's recent plant upgrades have improved production efficiency, but Rivian still needs to be more profitable. Analysts' EPS estimates have changed 15 times in the last 90 days, indicating uncertainty among analysts regarding Rivian's financial stability. Rivian's market position is solidifying in the competitive EV sector, but the company's path to profitability is still under construction. The company's strategic initiatives, including developing the R2 platform, are crucial for its long-term lead. Therefore, it is prudent to hold off on buying Rivian stock until after the Q2 earnings report to gauge the company's performance post-earnings before making further investment decisions.
news knowledge.title: Hold On! Don't Buy Rivian Stock Ahead of Earnings. Wait for the Drop.

news knowledge.eng_title: Rivian (RIVN) to release critical Q2 earnings: Here's what to expect
news knowledge.summary: Rivian (RIVN) is set to release its critical Q2 2024 earnings on August 6, 2024. The company has been aggressively cutting costs to achieve a gross profit by the end of the year. In the second quarter, Rivian delivered 13,790 vehicles, a slight increase from the first quarter. However, production at its Normal, IL plant fell to 9,612 vehicles, a trend expected after a planned shutdown in April. CEO RJ Scaringe has said that the upgrades have made 'meaningful' impacts on costs and efficiency. Rivian expects to cut costs even more with the introduction of new tech, such as its Maximus motor or 'Enduro Gen 2.' Despite a 'messy' second quarter, Rivian remains on the path to profitability, with executives reiterating that the company will achieve its first positive gross profit by the end of the year. According to Estimize, Rivian is expected to report a loss of $1.17 per share on revenue of $1.18 billion in Q2 2024. Rivian's stock is up 42% over the past three months, but share prices are still down 40% over the past year.
news knowledge.title: Rivian (RIVN) to release critical Q2 earnings: Here's what to expect

news knowledge.eng_title: The Investment Case for Rivian (RIVN) Ahead of Q2 Earnings
news knowledge.summary: Rivian Automotive (RIVN) is set to release its second-quarter 2024 earnings on August 6. The Zacks Consensus Estimate predicts a loss of $1.17 per share on revenues of $1.1 billion. Despite the expected loss, Rivian's CEO RJ Scaringe is optimistic about the company's future, citing its retooling efforts to improve plant efficiency and reduce production costs. The company has also partnered with Volkswagen to share EV technology and software, and has introduced new product lines, including the R2, R3, and R3X, which promise impressive performance and range at lower prices. Rivian aims to achieve gross profit by the fourth quarter of 2024 and positive adjusted EBITDA by 2027. Investors are advised to buy the stock at current levels to reap long-term rewards. 'Rivian's new MSP product lines promise impressive performance, utility and range at significantly lower prices than the flagship R1,' according to the article.
news knowledge.title: The Investment Case for Rivian (RIVN) Ahead of Q2 Earnings

news knowledge.eng_title: RIVN Warning: This May Be Your Last Chance to Escape Rivian Stock.
news knowledge.summary: Rivian Automotive (NASDAQ:RIVN) may be facing a crucial test after its recent stock rally. The company is set to release its second-quarter 2024 financial results on August 6, which could be a major letdown if the market has front-run its assumption of amazing results. Additionally, Rivian is facing a setback in California's legal system, where a judge has ruled that the company will go to trial over allegations that it encouraged employees to steal trade secrets from Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA). With Rivian's history of income negativity and no expected profits for years, investors should be cautious and consider making defensive portfolio adjustments before the company's results are released.
news knowledge.title: RIVN Warning: This May Be Your Last Chance to Escape Rivian Stock.

news knowledge.eng_title: Investors in Rivian Automotive, Inc. Should Contact Levi & Korsinsky Before July 30, 2024 to Discuss Your Rights
news knowledge.summary: Levi & Korsinsky, LLP is notifying investors in Rivian Automotive, Inc. (RIVN) of a class action securities lawsuit. The lawsuit seeks to recover losses on behalf of Rivian investors who were affected by alleged securities fraud between August 12, 2022 and February 21, 2024. The complaint alleges that Rivian made false statements and concealed information about its business, including overstated demand for its products and ability to withstand negative macroeconomic impacts. Investors who suffered a loss in Rivian during the relevant time frame have until July 30, 2024 to request that the Court appoint them as lead plaintiff. There is no cost or obligation to participate.
news knowledge.title: Investors in Rivian Automotive, Inc. Should Contact Levi & Korsinsky Before July 30, 2024 to Discuss Your Rights

news knowledge.eng_title: The Gross Law Firm Reminds Rivian Automotive, Inc. Investors of the Pending Class Action Lawsuit with a Lead Plaintiff Deadline of July 30, 2024
news knowledge.summary: The Gross Law Firm is reminding investors of Rivian Automotive, Inc. (NASDAQ: RIVN) of a pending class action lawsuit with a lead plaintiff deadline of July 30, 2024. The lawsuit alleges that Rivian made false and/or misleading statements about demand for its products and its ability to withstand negative macroeconomic impacts, leading to reduced demand and increased customer cancellations. Shareholders who purchased shares of RIVN during the class period (August 12, 2022 to February 21, 2024) are encouraged to contact the firm regarding possible lead plaintiff appointment. There is no cost or obligation to participate in the case.
news knowledge.title: The Gross Law Firm Reminds Rivian Automotive, Inc. Investors of the Pending Class Action Lawsuit with a Lead Plaintiff Deadline of July 30, 2024
